metadata.Title: CVE-2022-41848 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: drivers/char/pcmcia/synclink_cs.c in the Linux kernel through 5.19.12 has a race condition and resultant use-after-free if a physically proximate attacker removes a PCMCIA device while calling ioctl, aka a race condition between mgslpc_ioctl and mgslpc_detach.

notes.Note: sbeattie> unfixed upstream as of 2023.01.10 cascardo> requires physically proximate access to systems with PCMCIA

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-signed package in trusty is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
linux-signed-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
